Hi Cedric! Did you know that the average Revolutionary War soldier needed about 4,000 calories a day?
It was, especially considering the food they had available. What were they eating?
Mostly hardtack, meat, and whatever they could forage.
It was! It was basically just flour and water, baked hard as a rock.
Ouch. Did they have any fresh fruits or vegetables?
Not often. They relied heavily on preserved foods.
Sounds like they were definitely lacking in vitamins!
